text: To investigate the effects of eEF1A on the CSFV replication , stable PK - 15 cell line overexpressing EGFP - eEF1A ( PK - EGFP - eEF1A ) or EGFP ( PK - EGFP ) was generated and infected with the CSFV Shimen strain at a multiplicity of infection ( MOI ) of 0 . 1 . The N pro expression in the CSFV - infected PK - EGFP - eEF1A cells was decreased at 48 and 72 h post - infection ( hpi ) , compared with that in the PK - EGFP cells ( Figure 3A , B ) . Real - time RT - PCR analysis revealed that the viral genome copies in the PK - EGFP - eEF1A cells were also reduced at 48 and 72 hpi , compared with the PK - EGFP cells ( Figure 3C ) . Additionally , yields of infectious virus in culture supernatant of PK - EGFP - eEF1A cells were decreased at 48 and 72 hpi ( Figure 3D ) . The results indicated the eEF1A negatively modulates the CSFV replication .
